sentences.english: Kentucky farms produce some of the world's finest pure breed horses.
sentences.chinese: 肯塔基州農場出產一些世界上最好的純種馬。

sentences.english: A rare pedigreed entrant in a summer of mules.
sentences.chinese: 在一羣夏季影片的騾子裏，這是一匹罕見的純種馬。

sentences.english: Live turkeys, pure-bred breeding animals, weighing not more than 185 g.
sentences.chinese: 火雞，純種繁殖用，重量185公克及以下者。

sentences.english: Sea Tiger is a military canine, a pure German shepherd.
sentences.chinese: 海虎是一條軍犬，純種的德國黑背。

sentences.english: We have lots of valuable and purebred pets for sale.
sentences.chinese: 我們銷售許多寶貴的純種寵物。

sentences.english: All they knew was that this Lab was a purebred.
sentences.chinese: 他們只知道馬利是條純種拉布拉多犬。

sentences.english: Jess:That is your very own, certified, purebred, giant troll hunter.
sentences.chinese: 這是屬於你的，經鑑定純種的巨怪獵手。

sentences.english: This five-year-old thoroughbred mare is allergic to grass.
sentences.chinese: 這隻五歲的純種母馬對青草過敏。

sentences.english: Purebred horses are much more expensive than mixed breeds.
sentences.chinese: 純種馬比雜交馬的價格昂貴得多。

sentences.english: In dogs, purebreds are valuable. How about people?
Something has gone terribly wrong with thoroughbred racing.
sentences.chinese: 純種馬問題存在很嚴重的錯誤。

sentences.english: Excessive barking can occur in purebred dogs as well as mixed breeds.
sentences.chinese: 汪汪過量可發生於純種犬以及混合品種。

sentences.english: Unlike horse-racing, the contest is not restricted to thoroughbreds.
sentences.chinese: 不像賽馬，該競賽並不侷限於純種動物。

sentences.english: This means we can't yet be sure purebred dogs resemble their owners.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能肯定純種狗是否會和其主人越來越相似。

sentences.english: Where to sell purebred chow ah?
Live swine, weighing less than 50kg, other than pure-bred breeding animals.
sentences.chinese: 豬，重量少於50公斤者，純種繁殖用除外。

definition: to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
to breed (livestock, fish, crops etc)/to grow/to raise
petit bourgeois/yuppie/abbr. of 小資產階級|小资产阶级
to make a mess/to mess with/to be wild/to sleep around/to jump into bed
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
